data.name: String Calculator
data.description:
Create a simple string calculator function that takes a string ```numbers```
The function should be able to take in an unknown amount of numbers e.g ```"1"``` or ```"1,2"``` and return their sum as an integer. If given an empty string the function should return 0.
All numbers will be positive. Allow the function to handle new lines between numbers (instead of commas) e.g:
a) the following should be accomodated ```"1\n2,3"```
b) the following will not be given so no need to cover: ```"1,\n"```
Support different delimiters \n To change the delimiter, the beginning of the provided string will contain an extra line that looks like this:
```"//[delimiter]\nnumbers"``` for example ```"//[;]\n1;2"```.
This example should return 3, where ';' is the specified delimiter.
Numbers bigger than 1000 should be ignored, so adding 2 + 1001 should return 2.
Delimiters can be of any length, for example ```"//[***]\n1***2***3"``` should return 6.
Allow multiple delimiters for example ```"//[*][%]\n1*2%3"``` should return 6.
make sure you can handle multiple delimiters with lengths of more than 1.
